intro: Clidemia umbellata, commonly known as false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub or a climbing vine, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Clidemia umbellata is also noted for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats, making it a common weed in some areas.
